meanings.sent1: During the meeting, Sarah would yack about her weekend nonstop.
meanings.sent2: The children would yack excitedly about their favorite toys.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Tom's yacking kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: The birds in the park yacked loudly, filling the air with noise.
meanings.sent5: His yacking was like a never-ending stream of words flowing out.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to their yack; it's just silly stories.
meanings.sent2: The teacher ignored the students' yack and focused on the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The yack at the town hall meeting made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The yack of the gossip magazines was nothing but empty words.
meanings.sent5: Her yack was like a babbling brook, never making much sense.

meanings.sent1: The dog yacked up his dinner on the carpet.
meanings.sent2: After the roller coaster ride, she felt like she might yack.
meanings.sent3: The baby yacked all over his bib, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the garbage made him yack uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The food was so bad, it made him yack almost immediately.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh cry or squawk
meanings.sent1: The yack of the seagulls echoed across the beach.
meanings.sent2: The yack of the crow startled the hikers in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The yack of the parrot made everyone laugh at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The yack of the peacock was a unique sound in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The yack of the eagle pierced through the silence of the valley.
